channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-19326] stats auto gather: incorrect aggregation during UNION queries (may lead to incorrect results)
item.description:
Found when investigating the results change after converting tables to MM, turns out the MM result is correct but the current one is not.
The test ends like so:

desc formatted small_alltypesorc_a;
ANALYZE TABLE small_alltypesorc_a COMPUTE STATISTICS;
desc formatted small_alltypesorc_a;
insert into table small_alltypesorc_a select * from small_alltypesorc1a;
desc formatted small_alltypesorc_a;

The results from the descs in the golden file are:

	COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE	{\"BASIC_STATS\":\"true\"}
	numFiles            	1                   
	numRows             	5                               
...
	COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE	{\"BASIC_STATS\":\"true\"}
	numFiles            	1                   
	numRows             	15                                
...
	COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE	{\"BASIC_STATS\":\"true\"}
	numFiles            	2                   
	numRows             	20

Note the result change after analyze - the original nomRows is inaccurate, but BASIC_STATS is set to true.

I am assuming with metadata only optimization this can produce incorrect results.
item.summary: stats auto gather: incorrect aggregation during UNION queries (may lead to incorrect results)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
ashutoshc prasanth_j looks like a stats issue that may cause problems with metadata only queries.
Can you confirm the latter part (ie whether this is important if BASIC_STATS=true but numRows is wrong).

This issue is present on the current master; and indeed: it causes incorrect results when hive.optimize.metadataonly is enabled.
Good eye sershe; it seems its like this since 2015

actually this seems to be 2 issues:

  • there was an issue which arised from the fact that all the rs-es have overwritten eachothers output - I've fixed this..and now ctas for unions work as expected
  • if hive.merge.tezfiles is enabled ; somehow the counters also get merged or something...I'm not sure if this is enabled in production environments or not...I'll take another look

I think hive.optimize.metadataonly should be enabled for all tests...or at least check that all tests would pass with it...

Update: union_stats golden file has actual incorrect result from this I think.
src union all src is inserted (which should be 2x500 rows) but count(1) result is 500.
So is this just test issue?
no, this is a stats optimizer bug
This is incorrect results bug in the default config (metadata-only queries enabled)
Thanks for confirming. Is someone working on a patch for this? If not let us push this out of 3.0 and fix this in bug fix release.
I've a "half-fix": it's fixed in most cases, but if hive.merge.tezfiles is enabled the problem still occurs.
Should we commit that and then do a follow-up?
well..I think we are better of with it; then without it

-1 overall
